text:
Copeland is a city in Gray County, Kansas, United States. As of the 2010 census, 310 people lived there.
History.
Copeland was founded in 1912. It was named for E. L. Copeland, an official of the Santa Fe Railroad.
The first post office in Copeland was founded in October 1912.
Geography.
According to the United States Census Bureau says that the city has a total area of. All of it is land.
2010 census.
As of the 2010 census says that there were 310 people, 112 households, and 87 families living in the city.
Education.
South Gray Schools has two parts: Copeland USD 476 and Montezuma USD 371. They include an Elementary school and Junior High School in Copeland, and an Elementary and High School in Montezuma.
Before to school unification, Copeland was home to Copeland High School, which had a mascot known as the Vikings.
